main event: A round, flaming object with a long smoke trail was reported moving from east to west across Tennessee, Kentucky, and Indiana on July 10, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as ranging in color from reddish-white to orange.
The sighting was reported almost simultaneously from several locations, including Hendersonville, Tennessee; Scottsville, Kentucky; Godwin Airfield and Fort Knox, Kentucky; and Milltown, Indiana.
The characteristics and description of the object suggest it was a true bolide or 'fireball', likely related to the Capricornid and Aquarid meteor showers occurring at the time.
The object was observed for approximately 15 seconds.
No photographs of the object were included in the report.
sighted object: round, flaming object with long smoke trail
